column4: does anyone know the advantage of using the new broadcom wireless drivers instead of ndiswraper?
ya there is a new module called bcm4xx or something
well i was looking for a 'review' of them but no result
they seem pretty flacky to me compared with ndiswrapper, but there might be an advantage in avoiding windows drivers...
without really knowing, my guess would be (a) free software ideals and (b) distributability.
that's what i would guess but i'm more interesting in the practical solution and ndiswrapper seems to work fine
the only other thing I can think of is that ndiswrapper has no way to support master mode.  Free drivers _might_ support master mode, depending on the driver.
master mode, is that the same as ad-hoc mode?
no.  in master mode, your computer plays the same role as a wireless router
well that is a pretty nice feature but i'd rather be able to run g mode not just b and ndiswrapper only supports b
ehh?  You mean the bcm4xx drivers only support b?
i've read it in a few places and also the instructions require that you set your ap to allow mixed mode
mixed mode is when the ap allows both 802.11b and g
I'm really no familiar with the details; and it's not clear that the bcm4xx driver even supports master mode
